faqs.question: Does UT Habitat have dues?
faqs.answer: Yes. Members joining in the Fall Semester can either pay $50 for the entire year or $35 for the Fall (and the remaining $15 in the Spring Semester). Members joining in the Spring Semester must pay $35 for the semester. We understand that college is expensive. If dues are a concern, we encourage prospective members/current members to talk to our Treasurer at the beginning of the semester to arrange an alternative option. Nobody will be denied participation in UT Habitat due to financial obligations being too large a burden.

faqs.question: Do I need experience?
faqs.answer: No experience required. There are professionals and experienced volunteers on-site who will teach you everything!

faqs.question: Do I need to be a specific major to join UT Habitat?
faqs.answer: No, all majors are welcomed! Our members represent nearly all of the colleges at UT, including graduate programs!

faqs.question: How do I join UT Habitat?
faqs.answer: You can join by attending a general meeting or a Build event. Follow us on Instagram or join our mailing list to stay updated on upcoming events.

faqs.question: Is transportation provided for Builds?
faqs.answer: Yes! We organize carpools for every Build. You can sign up to drive or request a ride in the Build signup form each week.

faqs.question: What do I need to bring to a Build?
faqs.answer: Wear clothes you donâ€™t mind getting dirty, closed-toe shoes, and bring a water bottle. All tools and safety equipment will be provided on-site.

faqs.question: Do I have to go to every general meeting or Build?
faqs.answer: No, our events are flexible! While regular participation is encouraged, we understand students have varying schedules. Come when you can!

faqs.question: What is the time commitment like?
faqs.answer: We have general meetings once every two weeks and Build events on Saturday mornings. You can participate as often as your schedule allows.

faqs.question: I used to be in UT Habitat, how do I rejoin?
faqs.answer: Welcome back! Just start coming to our meetings and Builds again. You'll need to pay dues for the current semester to be an active member.

faqs.question: How do I become an officer?
faqs.answer: Officer applications open near the end of each semester. Attend meetings, volunteer at events, and keep an eye out for announcements about applications!
